context: Hi there are you interested in some classic comedies?
I am actually looking for movies for my 12 yr olds sleepover

There is a movie called Uncle Buck and it is absolutely hilarious. Well Uncle Buck is family friendly I could do better I am sure. How abut The Hunger Games (2012) and The Hunger Games: Catching Fire (2013)
I dont think the kids would be interested in a movie that old. Hunger Games they have seen and love
They really liked Sky High (2003) when I showed that to them and Wonder Woman (2017) could be good too
I could also suggest X-Men: Apocalypse (2016).
I think I will try that with them as well.
resp: or the newest one I believe is Logan (2017) .

context.content: Hi there are you interested in some classic comedies?
I am actually looking for movies for my 12 yr olds sleepover

There is a movie called Uncle Buck and it is absolutely hilarious. Well Uncle Buck is family friendly I could do better I am sure. How abut The Hunger Games (2012) and The Hunger Games: Catching Fire (2013)
I dont think the kids would be interested in a movie that old. Hunger Games they have seen and love
They really liked Sky High (2003) when I showed that to them and Wonder Woman (2017) could be good too
I could also suggest X-Men: Apocalypse (2016).
I think I will try that with them as well.

I would recommend the following items: 1: X-Men: Apocalypse (2016)
2: X-Men: First Class (2011)
3: X-Men (2000)
4: X-Men
5: X-Men: Days of Future Past (2014)
6: X-Men: The Last Stand (2006)
7: X-Men Origins: Wolverine (2009)
8: The Wolverine (2013)
9: Deadpool (2016)
10: The Avengers (2012)

12: Oz the Great and Powerful (2013)
13: Avengers: Age of Ultron (2015)
14: Avengers: Infinity War (2018)
15: Logan (2017)

17: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice (2016)
18: The Fantastic Four
19: Fantastic Four (2015)
20: The Avengers (1998)
21: 3 Avengers

23: Avengers Grimm (2015)

25: Ant-Man (2015)

28: Hugo (2011)

41: Epic (2013)
42: Captain America: The First Avenger
43: Big Hero 6 (2014)
44: Les Misérables (2012)
45: Ant-Man and the Wasp (2018)
46: The Amazing Spider-Man (2012)
47: Dr. Strange
48: The Amazing Spider-Man 2 (2014)
49: Rise of the Planet of the Apes (2011)
50: Ex Machina (2015)
:Great! To help me provide more recommendations, could you let me know if they prefer animated movies, superhero films, or any specific genres?

I think they would really enjoy a film that combines action and emotional depth, featuring a strong character arc and a gritty storyline. It's a film that showcases a unique take on the superhero genre, with a focus on themes of sacrifice and legacy. The characters are well-developed, and it has some intense action sequences that would keep them engaged. Plus, it has a great balance of drama and action that resonates well with both younger and older audiences.

simulator_dialog.resp: or the newest one I believe is Logan (2017) .
